result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy S. Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 2:09 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jeremy S. Williams in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Shock informs the Court that there is no victim impact statement for this case

Court IMPOSES & STAYS 3 YEARS PRISON CONSISTING OF 1 AND 1 HALF YEARS INITIAL CONFINEMENT AND 1 AND 1 HALF YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith - Sentence may transfer to Rock County, as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No restitution ordered

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Given
If revoked, the Court finds the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Recess: 2:24 pm
character reference letter submitted by Attorney Zarwell
Criminal Case Settlement
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 10:01am [mo]
[Scheduled for STC today]
Attorney Jon R. Wilsnack appears via telephone.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jeremy S. Williams does NOT appear.

The Court indicates that it received a fax from Atty. Wilsnack on 11/2/15 indicating that Mr. Williams is needed in another county for court on the same date and time as scheduled in Jefferson County, Branch III.
The Court further indicates that the Court's JA was advised that the other Court hearing was in Winnebago Co, Ill., the Court's JA contacted the Court officials in Winnebago Co and was informed that Mr. Williams' hearing was scheduled for today at 2:00pm, and it was scheduled subsequently to the hearing here in Jefferson Co. 

The Court notes that Probable Cause has already been found
The Court issues a bench warrant, body only.

recess: 10:10am
Atty Wilsnack may appear for the 11/3/15 status by phone

Conflict review worksheet

On this date Defendant Jeremy Williams came to the Branch III Courtroom at 2:00pm for a hearing.  After the clerk's review of the file, the clerk [MK] explained to Mr. Williams that while this case had been scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance on this date, the hearing had been removed from the Court's calendar at the request of Defense Counsel, Attorney Jon R. Wilsnack, and by agreement by the State, and that the case is now scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance on September 14th at 10:00am.

Case called at 3:00pm [mo]
Defendant Jeremy S. Williams in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given, Mr. Williams indicates that he desires counsel
  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Williams. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

The Court requires a $2,500  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--to report to the Jefferson County State Public Defender's office today to advise them he is seeking their representation
--no contact with Kevin Rusch
--no presence at W5598 Curtis Mill Rd, Town of Koshkonong
recess: 3:06pm
